meanings.definition: To understand or perceive the meaning of something.
meanings.sent1: I can apprehend the story in the book.
meanings.sent3: Trying to apprehend a foreign language can be challenging.
meanings.sent4: His mind could apprehend complex ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: With practice, you will apprehend the concept easily.

meanings.definition: To arrest someone for a crime.
meanings.sent1: The police apprehended the suspect at the scene.
meanings.sent2: They apprehended the thief before he could escape.
meanings.sent3: The officer apprehended the criminal with ease.
meanings.sent4: The detectives apprehended the fugitive after a long chase.
meanings.sent5: The security guard apprehended the shoplifter red-handed.

meanings.definition: To anticipate with fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She apprehended the upcoming exam nervously.
meanings.sent2: He apprehended the dark alley with caution.
meanings.sent3: The child apprehended the haunted house with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The hiker apprehended the steep cliff ahead.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds made her apprehend the approaching storm.
